skill.name: commit-prepare
skill.description: Prepare git commit messages following conventional commits. Activates on: commit, prepare commit, commit this, commit message, ready to commit, stage and commit
skill.summary: Prepare git commit messages following conventional commits. Activates on: commit, prepare commit, co...
skill.author: ByronWilliamsCPA

security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-only skill consisting of a single SKILL.md file with workflow instructions. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access beyond what the AI platform provides. The skill only provides guidelines for preparing conventional commit messages.

content.value_statement: Writing clear commit messages is difficult and inconsistent across team members. This skill helps generate standardized commit messages following the conventional commits format, making your git history searchable and understandable.
actual_capabilities: Analyzes staged and unstaged git changes to understand context
Determines commit type (feat, fix, docs, refactor, test, chore, perf, ci)
Generates conventional commit messages following standard format
Handles breaking changes with proper footer notation
Reviews changes for sensitive data before committing
Executes git commit with proper HEREDOC syntax for multi-line messages
limitations: Does not automatically stage files without user confirmation
Requires user approval before executing git commit
Does not push changes to remote repositories
Does not resolve merge conflicts or complex git situations

use_cases.title: Standardize Personal Commits
use_cases.description: Create consistent, meaningful commit messages for personal projects without memorizing format rules

use_cases.title: Enforce Team Standards
use_cases.description: Ensure all team members follow conventional commits for better changelog generation and release management

use_cases.title: Improve Contribution Quality
use_cases.description: Submit commits that match project conventions and make maintainer reviews easier

prompt_templates.title: Quick Commit
prompt_templates.prompt: commit these changes with a conventional commit message

prompt_templates.title: Breaking Change
prompt_templates.prompt: This is a breaking change. Prepare a commit message that clearly documents the breaking change and migration steps

prompt_templates.title: Documentation Update
prompt_templates.prompt: Prepare a commit message for my documentation updates

prompt_templates.title: Complex Changes
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze my staged changes and suggest the best commit message structure. If changes should be separate, list them individually

output: I see these files are staged:
Implement automatic token refresh when access token expires.
Includes retry logic with exponential backoff.
Shall I commit with this message?

best_practices: Always review the generated commit message before confirming execution
Use imperative mood in subject lines (add, not added; fix, not fixed)
Include the 'why' of changes in the body, not just the 'what'
anti_patterns: Using vague messages like 'fixed bug' or 'updated code'
Skipping the body when changes are complex or non-obvious
Committing without checking for accidentally staged credentials or secrets

faq.question: What conventional commit types are supported?
faq.answer: feat, fix, docs, refactor, test, perf, chore, ci, and style. Each has specific use cases outlined in the skill.

faq.question: How many characters can the subject line be?
faq.answer: Maximum 50 characters for the subject line. The body should wrap at 72 characters.

faq.question: Does this integrate with my IDE?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. IDE integration depends on your AI assistant's configuration.

faq.question: Is my commit data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No. This skill only provides instructions to your AI assistant. All git operations occur locally on your machine.

faq.question: Why are my changes being rejected?
faq.answer: The skill may suggest splitting unrelated changes into separate commits. Review each suggestion and confirm staging decisions.

faq.question: How is this different from commit message templates?
faq.answer: This skill actively analyzes your staged changes and generates appropriate messages automatically, rather than just providing static templates.
